conversation.content: Hi, um. My blender just died. Got it last year.
Okay okay. Let me. Pull up your account here. Do you have the order number?
Uh, yeah. Let me see here... ORD-4492.
Perfect perfect. So I'm looking at. Order ORD-4492-BX. Purchased thirteen months ago. The Precision Pro model right?
Yeah. Stopped working yesterday. Just... dead.
That's. That's frustrating. So the warranty on model PPB-750. It expired. Hmm. Just last month actually.
Of course it did. Er, is there anything...?
Let me let me check something. Sometimes we have. Like. Extended coverage options. Account number AC-89234-K shows. No extended plan. But hold on.
Figures. What's the word... Murphy's Law, right?
Yeah basically. So so what I'm seeing. The warranty expired thirty-seven days ago. Which is. Pretty close. Let me check if...
Thirty-seven days. Great. Um, can you maybe make an exception?
I'm. Looking at our policy now. Code WP-2024 says. Technically no exceptions. But but. Sometimes for customers with. Good history like yours...
Okay so that means... what exactly?
So basically I can. Submit form EXC-7291. For review. It goes to. My supervisor. Takes about forty-eight hours usually.
Forty-eight hours. Hmm. Better than nothing I guess.
Right right. Also. Checking repair options. Service ticket ST-66298 would be. Eighty-nine dollars. If the exception doesn't...
Eighty-nine? Er, that's like half what I paid.
Yeah I know. The part that failed. Motor assembly MA-2847-C. It's. Pretty expensive unfortunately. But if we get approval...
Fine. Submit it. Not expecting much though.
Submitted submitted. Reference number REF-93847-TK. You'll get an email. Either way. And honestly. These sometimes. Do get approved so...

scenario: upset because the product broke right after the warranty expired
